Area.description: Represents a climbing area with its properties and nested areas or climbs.

id.description: A unique identifier for the area.

areaName.description: The name that this area is commonly identified by within the climbing community.

climbs.description: The climbs that appear within this area. If this area is a leaf node, then these climbs can be understood as appearing physically on - rather than within - this area.

children.description: Nested areas within the current area. Can be either an array of areas or a single area object.

gradeContext.description: The grading system used for climbing/bouldering in the area. Inherits from parent node if current node does not have one. UIAA = UIAA/font, US = yds/vscale, FR = french/font (see https://github.com/OpenBeta/openbeta-graphql/blob/9c517329db079c922fe7f092a78b658cb295e158/src/GradeUtils.ts#L40)

leaf.description: Indicates if the area has no child areas.

isBoulder.description: Indicates if the area is primarily for bouldering.

lnglat.description: The longitude and latitude of the area.

type.description: The type of the geo-coordinate, always 'Point'.

bbox.description: The bounding box of the area.

leftRightIndex.description: A numeric index used for sorting climbs from left to right (of a wall).

ext_id.description: An external identifier for the area.

content.description: Content related to the area, such as descriptions.

description.description: A textual description of the area.

Climb.description: Represents a climbing route with its properties.

id.description: A unique identifier for the climb.

name.description: The name that this climb is commonly identified by.

grade.description: The difficulty grade of the climb. Must be coherent with gradeContext. I. e. gradeContext = 'US' requires denomination in yds/vscale (climbing/bouldering), so '5.11'/'V14', 'FR' would be french/font '9c+'/'9a', 'UIIA' would be uiaa/font '9+'/'9a'. (see https://github.com/OpenBeta/sandbag)

gradeContext.description: The grading system used for climbing/bouldering in the area. Normally inherited from parent area. UIAA = UIAA/font, US = yds/vscale, FR = french/font (climbing/bouldering) (see https://github.com/OpenBeta/openbeta-graphql/blob/9c517329db079c922fe7f092a78b658cb295e158/src/GradeUtils.ts#L40)

fa.description: The first ascent information of the climb. Usually formatted as: name(s) (year).

type.description: What sort of climb is this? Climbs can combine these fields, which is why this is not an enumeration.

safety.description: The safety rating of a climb based on US movie ratings. See https://github.com/OpenBeta/openbeta-graphql/blob/9c517329db079c922fe7f092a78b658cb295e158/src/graphql/schema/Climb.gql#L177.

boltsCount.description: The number of bolts (fixed anchors) on the climb.

length.description: Total length in meters if known (-1 otherwise)

pitches.description: List of Pitch objects representing individual pitches of a multi-pitch climb

id.description: A unique identifier for the pitch.

parentId.description: The unique identifier of the parent climb.

pitchNumber.description: The number of the pitch in the sequence.

grade.description: The difficulty grade of the pitch (see Climb.grade)

disciplines.description: The climbing disciplines applicable to the pitch. (see Climb.grade)

length.description: The length of the pitch in meters

boltsCount.description: The number of bolts (fixed anchors) on the pitch.

description.description: A textual description of the pitch.

lnglat.description: The longitude and latitude of the climb.

type.description: The type of the geo-coordinate, always 'Point'.

leftRightIndex.description: A numeric index used for sorting or positioning.

mp_id.description: An identifier used in Mountain Project's database.

mp_crag_id.description: The identifier of the crag in Mountain Project's database.

areaRef.description: A reference to the area containing the climb.

content.description: Composable attributes for this climb, these are the bread and butter guidebook-like data that make up the bulk of the text beta for this climb.

description.description: The description of this climb, this is the main text field for this climb. This contains beta, visual descriptors, and any other information useful to identifying and attempting the climb

protection.description: What do climbers need to know about making a safe attempt of this climb? What gear do they need, what are the hazards, etc.

location.description: Information regarding Approach and other location context for this climb. Could also include information about the situation of this specific climb.
